text: Dorian "Doe" Boyland is a former Major League Baseball first baseman who was drafted in the second round of the 1976 Major League Baseball Draft by the Pittsburgh Pirates. He would play in just 21 games with the team in 1978, 1979, and 1981 and was later traded to the San Francisco Giants for Tom Griffin. He played at the collegiate level at the University of Wisconsin- Oshkosh.
